page.title: 19A BRANCH BANK, BANKS
page.content: THE NATIONAL WESTMINSTER BRANCH BANK AT BANKS IS A SMALL SUB-BRANCH OPENING DAILY FOR THREE HOURS.IT WAS ORIGINALLY OPENED IN 1866 AND UNTIL COMPARATIVELY RECENTLY BANKING FACILITIES WERE ONLY AVAILABLE THREE DAYS A WEEK. A FORMER DISTRICT BANK BRANCH BEFORE THE MERGER OF WESTMINSTER/DISTRICT AND NATIONAL PROVINCIAL IT WAS ORIGINALLY PART OF THE MANCHESTER AND LIVERPOOL BANKING CO. THE CUSTOMERS ARE A VARIED CROSS SECTION OF THE COMMUNITY:HOUSEWIVES, SHOPKEEPERS,FARMERS,MARKET GARDENERS AND HOSPITAL STAFF FROM GREAVES HALL. THERE ARE MANY AND VARIED ENQUIRIES DAILY AND ANY PROBLEMS WHICH THE BRANCH CANNOT DEAL WITH ARE REFERRED TO THE PARENT BRANCH AT SOUTHPORT. THE AMOUNT OF BUSINESS VARIES FROM WEEK TO WEEK WITH THE BUSIEST DAYS BEING MONDAY AND FRIDAY.
